docString: Every even number is the square of a natural number.
choices: This statement is incorrect. There is no theorem that states every even number is the square of a natural number.
This statement is incorrect. An even number can only be the square of a natural number if it is also a perfect square. For example, 6 is an even number but it is not the square of any natural number.
